text: i want to be cool i want to be like in with all  those kids that play cool games like all the kids   that play indie games and i've been hearing a lot  of discourse on twitter about this game called   cozy grove and so i thought hey let's check it out  and let me tell you i've been having a freaking   blast so i thought it would be really fun to do  a little review video for all of you and show   you cozy grove tell you just a little bit about it  i'm not like really that good at reviewing things   so we'll just go ahead and hop in alright don't  forget to subscribe it helps me out a butt load   and check me out on twitch if you want to come see  us play cozy grove we try to play it just a little   bit before we get our stream started just to kind  of get us in the mood you know so definitely come   check us out let's get into cozy grove and what  it's all about welcome to cozy grove a game about   camping on a haunted ever-changing island as a

text: it's all about welcome to cozy grove a game about   camping on a haunted ever-changing island as a  spirit scout you'll wander the island's forest   each day finding new hidden secrets and helping  soothe the local ghosts with a little time and a   lot of crafting you'll bring color and joy back  to cozy grove cozy grove is currently available   on the nintendo switch ps4 xbox one and mac and  pc i did buy it on steam on sale actually it was   like 10 off i believe um maybe not when you watch  this video because it kind of just like depends   on when you're watching but i thought it was  definitely worth it i'm super glad that i ended   up getting it and on sale like how cool is that  so one thing about cozy grove that i really liked   was the whole aesthetic of it it kind of low-key  reminds me of don't starve if you've ever played   that i think that the aesthetics are pretty  similar um and kind of like the spooky little   haunted aspects of it you know it's kind of like

text: indeed a bear it's very cute but not just a bear   a ghost bear and not just a ghost bear a ghost  mixed with something else bear so there's like   a fox bear there's a postal bear a tree bear  a seagull bear ghost bear types of entities   are here once you start the game you get to slowly  progressively meet all these bears as you continue   through the story there's a ton of different bears  i'm still unlocking them like days later it's   great so you get to meet like a new friend every  day it's pretty cool and basically you complete   these quests for these bears and it helps unlock  further things throughout the game the game does   occur in real time so you're able to get on each  day and complete all sorts of different tasks each   time that you help a bear out you actually make  their area more colorful and i'm sure that a lot   of you guys have seen this in various trailers  or if you've seen anybody play the game but some   areas are going to have no color and other areas

text: or if you've seen anybody play the game but some   areas are going to have no color and other areas  are going to have color and it kind of switches   throughout the day as it you know progresses in  real time the whole color thing i thought was kind   of confusing but i caught on eventually basically  once you complete a quest that makes the area   that that bear is in more colorful and it kind  of switches throughout the day it's really cool   it's just like a never-ending cycle that we're  in kind of like life the first day that you play   you get to complete like a ton of quests and you  get to kind of catch up with the story and then   each day after that you have about i would say  like an hour consistently each day that i spend   playing just completing my daily quests and just  you know kind of vibin it kind of reminds me   and i hate to compare games here but it really  does remind me of animal crossing in that sense   because there's really only so much guided story

text: does remind me of animal crossing in that sense   because there's really only so much guided story  but outside of the guided story there is a lot   to do and even though you are completed with your  quests or you've got all of your daily stuff done   there's still more to the game that you can do all  by yourself a lot of the quests have to do with   foraging fishing you dig things up you harvest  trees you picket rocks all that good stuff that   you eventually unlock and just because you're not  doing a quest that actively involves those things   doesn't mean that you can't do that while you're  playing the game it's kind of cool you have kind   of the liberty to do what you want there's a whole  collections aspect of the game so with the seagull   bear you get to collect things and bring it to  him and he'll give you a reward kind of similar   to like a starde valley animal crossing museum
